title: Billy Gilmour reveals what Frank Lampard told him before Chelsea debut
text:
Billy Gilmour has made two first-team appearances for Chelsea this season (Picture: Getty)

Billy Gilmour has revealed that Frank Lampard advised him to invite his family to Stamford Bridge ahead of his senior debut for Chelsea against Sheffield United in August.

The 18-year-old has been tipped for a big future at Chelsea following his move to the club from Rangers in 2017 and has been integrated into Lampard’s first-team squad this season.

Gilmour was introduced from the bench late on during Chelsea’s 2-2 draw against Sheffield United in the Premier League and he feels Lampard’s decision that day demonstrates his faith in youth.

Gilmour made his Premier League debut against Sheffield United in August (Picture: Getty)

‘The night before, the gaffer kept asking if my family were coming down and saying make sure they come,’ the Scotland U21 international said.

‘We were 2-0 up and I’m thinking ‘this could be good’, but it was 2-1 when I came on. That shows you how much trust he has in the younger players to put you on in such a tight game.

‘It finished 2-2, which wasn’t the result I hoped for, but it made my dream come true of playing in the Premier League.’

Following his substitute appearance against Sheffield United, Gilmour had to wait until last month for his second first-team outing of the campaign against Grimsby Town in the Carabao Cup.

Although Gilmour didn’t get on the scoresheet during Chelsea’s 7-1 thrashing of the League Two side, his performance earned rave reviews from his manager after the game.

‘I thought Billy Gilmour was the best player on the pitch,’ Lampard said. ‘He moves the ball at a pace. Every pass he hits is punchy and into people’s feet. I’m delighted for him.’

Frank Lampard is a big admirer of Billy Gilmour’s talents (Picture: Getty)

Former Chelsea playmaker Cesc Fabregas was also impressed with Gilmour’s display, saying: ‘He played amazing tonight. Personality is the most important at this age and he’s got it all right.’

While Gilmour is one of Chelsea’s brightest young talents, midfield competition is fierce with Mason Mount, Ross Barkley, Jorginho, Mateo Kovacic and N’Golo Kante ahead of him in the pecking order.

Gilmour acknowledged he could benefit from a loan move away from Chelsea, saying: ‘I need to play more first-team games, at Chelsea or maybe out on loan. I need to get more experience.’
